CatDescriptText: Cutline of image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, April 17, 1954, pg. 13 reads: "Symposium Principals - When Atty. Carmel Carrington Marr, adviser to Ambassador Henry Cabot Lodge Jr., U.S. Representative to the United Nations, came here to be the main speaker at the National Achievement Clubs' annual Palm Sunday Symposium, she was tendered a luncheon by the family of steel executive Aaron Levinson, at his palatial home on Forbes Street...In the center are Mrs. Irene Hogan, who acted as proxy for the ill Mrs. Josephine Crunkelton, who won the Achievement Club trophy for being "Career Woman of 1954," and Morris Fountain, mortician, who won the men's trophy for being "Career Man of 1954."
TitMainTitle: Group portrait of Irene Hogan, proxy for Josephine Crunkelton, and Morris Fountain, holding trophies for Career Man and Woman of 1954, posed behind table with floral arrangement, and four candles, and trays of food, possibly Loendi Club
